author: JeffBrownTech
body:
When trying to create a remote PS session using the Skype Online PowerShell module, the following error occurs:

```
PS C:\ps> $skypesession = New-CsOnlineSession
Please enter the user principal name (ex. User@Domain.Com): admin@teamslab.us
Get-CsOnlinePowerShellAccessToken: C:\Program Files\Common Files\Skype for Business Online\Modules\SkypeOnlineConnector\SkypeOnlineConnectorStartup.psm1
Line |
 214 |             $accessToken = Get-CsOnlinePowerShellAccessToken @params
     |                            ^ One or more errors occurred. (Could not load type
     | 'System.Security.Cryptography.SHA256Cng' from assembly 'System.Core, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral,
     | PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089'.)
```

This is with the latest version of the Skype Online module and PowerShell 7 Preview 5.

[ps7newcsonlinesession.txt](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/files/3824871/ps7newcsonlinesession.txt)

![ps7skypeonline](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12574689/68482416-8f465800-0207-11ea-9bf5-5fa62ec37951.png)

comments.author: rjmholt
comments.body:
Looks like the module isn't .NET Core compatible.

The [Sha256Cng class](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.security.cryptography.sha256cng?view=netframework-4.8&viewFallbackFrom=netcore-3.0) isn't available in .NET Core 3.0.

To import this, you might want to look into the [WindowsCompatibility module](https://github.com/PowerShell/WindowsCompatibility).

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as external and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been be closed for housekeeping purposes.

comments.author: Ashish1662
comments.body: Hi @JeffBrownTech, did you solve your issue? I am facing exactly same issue. It will be great help if you could provide some inputs. I am using sfbOnlineConnector in PS az function app. It uses PS core internally.

comments.author: rjmholt
comments.body:
> I am using sfbOnlineConnector in PS az function app. It uses PS core internally.

It's likely that's running PowerShell 6.2.4, which doesn't have the implicit remoting compatibility fallback.

You might want to instead try the WindowsCompatibility module linked above.

comments.author: doctordns
comments.body:
The WIndows compatibility module is not being maintained as I understand it. It has been replaced by a more sane approach that integrates the logic into Import-Module. 

I'd recommend updating to 7.0 if at all possible.

title: Skype Online PowerShell Module: Unable to Create Session
